text: The Central Government may remove from office the Chairperson or any other Member of the National Commission if (a) they have been adjudged insolvent, (b) they have been convicted of an offence involving moral turpitude, (c) they have become physically or mentally incapable of acting as a Member, (d) they are of unsound mind and have been so declared by a competent court, (e) they have acquired financial or other interests likely to affect prejudicially their functions as a Member, or (f) they have misused their position to such an extent that their continuance in office is prejudicial to the public interest.

text: The repeal of an Act shall not affect the previous operation of the Act so repealed or anything duly done or suffered thereunder; any right, privilege, obligation or liability acquired, accrued or incurred under the Act so repealed; any penalty incurred in respect of any contravention under the Act so repealed; or any proceeding or remedy in respect of any such right, privilege, obligation, liability, penalty as aforesaid, and any such proceeding or remedy may be instituted, continued or enforced, and any such penalty may be imposed.

text: Any order made, any licence to practice issued, any registration made, any permission to start a new nursing college or institution, or to start higher course of studies, or for increase in the admission capacity granted, or any recognition of nursing qualifications granted under the Indian Nursing Council Act, 1947 (48 of 1947), which are in force as on the date of commencement of this Act, shall continue to be in force till the date of their expiry for all purposes.

text: The National Commission is the successor in interest to the Indian Nursing Council including its subsidiaries or owned trusts.

text: All the assets and liabilities of the Indian Nursing Council shall be deemed to have been transferred to the National Commission.

text: The educational standards, requirements and other provisions of the Indian Nursing Council Act, 1947 (48 of 1947) shall continue to be in force and operate till new standards or requirements are specified under this Act.
